Dr. Bin Xiao is a full professor at the Hong Kong Polytechnic University, Department of Computing. He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Texas at Dallas, USA in 2003. He is currently an associate editor of IEEE TCC and IEEE TNSE, IEEE ComSoc distinguished lecturer, and chair of IEEE ComSoc Communications and Information Security Technical Committee (CISTC Chair). He is also a Fellow of IEEE and a Fellow of AAIA.

Dr. Xiao's research group is looking for Ph.D. candidates in the areas of Data Science, focusing on security and privacy, and has available post-doc and research assistant positions. Recent successful grants as PI include projects on privacy-preserving and secure authentication of decentralized identity, digital asset security based on blockchain technology, vulnerability analysis and robustness improvement of 3D point cloud models, and security assessment of decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols.

The group has also achieved several notable accomplishments, including Ph.D. graduates receiving research assistant professor offers, undergraduate students publishing papers in top conferences, and winning prizes in research competitions. Dr. Xiao is also involved in organizing conferences, including IEEE GLOBECOM 2024 - Communication & Information Systems Security Symposium (CISS).
